page.text: You have defeated the robot. Now disabled, it slumps into a heap of tangled robotic limbs and actuators.

choice.text: Try to remove its computational components.
Try to remove something from its weapon system.
Try to remove the power unit

page.text: You attempt to extract the computational parts of the robot intact but your lack of skill just leads to you breaking them in an inept attempt to rip them out. They're useless now, but at least you have a few wires and chunks of the robot's casing as a souvenir. Or maybe it'll serve can as a paperweight, or raw material for future use.

choice.text: Ah well, better luck next time.

page.text: You attempt to extract the delicate computation valves. The devices take a careful touch to extract from the surrounding systems but your steady your hands and manage to successfully extract a computation valve from the robot's brain, so to speak. To celebrate, you dismantle some of its wiring and casing for some additional raw material.

You think you should try and extract the robot's weapon system, 'cause everything is better with lasers. Alas you're not as capable of that as you think you are and the robot's combination sensor and laser focusing optics is reduced to uselessness by your fumbling.

Looking at the robot's head, it's probably not possible to extract the laser system whole-cloth in any fashion that would be convenient or even possible to weild, but some elements may still be valuable. You set about dismounting the optical lenses and mirrors from inside the robot's otherwise empty head and soon enough, you have some relatively intact optical components for future use.

choice.text: Well, at least these might come in handy.

page.text: You set about attempting to extricate the power supply from deep inside the machine. Alas somewhere in trying to disengage it you must of done something wrong, there's a flash of arcing as something shorts out in a spectacular fashion. The device now emanates a sickly aroma of burnt plastics and fried electronics..yeah, you might of bungled this.

You delicately remove the power supply from deep within the robot's innards. Having to disengage various damaged electrical circuits from it and unhook it from the chassis takes a good deal of skill but such you have in ample amounts. You've acquired a battery from the robot's guts, huzzah.
